document_data.name: ''Nay''
document_data.mainbody: The '''''nay''''' ({{Pronounce|NAY}}) was a [[Zakhara]]n wind instrument that resembled a flute.{{Cite dragon/190/Sounds of Wonder & Delight}}
document_data.Description: ''Nays'' were made from dried, shellacked reeds or similar thin flora. Sounds were created by blowing through the main opening and manipulating holes made down the side of the instrument, creating a beautiful and eerie tone. The wonderful sound created by the ''nay'' inspired [[Zakharan (ethnicity)|Zakharans]] to call it ''amir al-harab'' which translated from [[Midani]] into "the prince of the wild wastes."
document_data.History: Despite the somewhat eerie sound that conjured thoughts of a haunted desert, the ''nay'' was used almost exclusively by the urban [[Al-Hadhar]].
